snippet: Mr. Carey was an underappreciated cog in the powerful Yankees machine of the 1950s that won four consecutive American League pennants and two World Series.
abstract: Andy Carey, underappreciated third basemen for the New York Yankees in the 1950s, dies at age 80.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Carey was an underappreciated cog in the powerful Yankees machine of the 1950s that won four consecutive American League pennants and two World Series.

headline.seo: Andy Carey, Third Baseman for 1950s Yankees, Dies at 80
headline.main: Andy Carey, Third Baseman for 1950s Yankees, Dies at 80
headline.print_headline: Andy Carey, 80, Infielder For Yankees of the 1950s
